required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Oxytocin at Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: The Pharmacokinetics of Oxytocin in Pregnant Women Undergoing Cesarean Delivery - a Feasibility Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to obtain data to inform the design of a population pharmacokinetic study of oxytocin after administration at CD as per standard institutional practice.

detailed_description.textblock: In this pilot study the investigators will compare plasma oxytocin concentrations measured in arterial and venous blood, after oxytocin administration at cesarean delivery, in order to assess the validity of venous samples. They will also measure oxytocinase to explore how levels vary around the time of delivery of the placenta and to assess the effect that this may have on the metabolism of oxytocin.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Scheduled samples during the first 30 minutes after oxytocin administration
primary_outcome.description: Concentration of oxytocin in arterial samples

primary_outcome.time_frame: Scheduled samples during the first 30 minutes after oxytocin administration
primary_outcome.description: Concentration of oxytocin in venous samples

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Scheduled samples during the first 30 minutes after oxytocin administration
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of oxytocinase in arterial samples

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Scheduled measurements during the first 30 minutes after oxytocin administration
secondary_outcome.description: Uterine tone measured using a Shore Durometer or assessed by obstetrician using numerical rating score (NRS, 0-10)
Incidence of systolic BP reduced by 20% from baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Estimated at the end of surgery

intervention.description: The investigators will take serial readings from a digital durometer at the uterine fundus at 3, 6, 9 and 12 minutes following OXT administration to provide data that will inform an estimate of the timing of peak effect. Shore durometers measure the hardness of materials on a scale of 0-100 Shore Units (SU). Preliminary (unpublished) data provided a range of 10-56 SU after oxytocin administration at cesarean delivery. Durometer readings were also shown to correlate positively with the obstetrician's manual assessment of uterine contractility, which is traditionally used to determine the success or failure of uterotonic therapy.

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women scheduled for cesarean delivery of their babies at term

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Term singleton pregnancy
- Age 18-45 years of age
- ASA classification 2 or 3
- Scheduled cesarean delivery under neuraxial anaesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age or ASA classification outside of inclusion criteria
- Need for general anaesthesia
- Absence of consent
- Inability to communicate in English or other barrier to providing informed consent

eligibility.gender_description: Participants must be scheduled for cesarean delivery of their baby
